cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest then north, then accelerate northeast across Florida’s Big Bend and emerge over the Atlantic off Georgia–South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast of Florida from the Keys northward to the Big Bend, then the Atlantic coasts of Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; mainly breezy conditions expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated along the southeast Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain totaling 3–5 inches with isolated amounts up to 7 inches could cause localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized street flooding and reduced visibility may disrupt port and road operations
